SEARCH
Module app
Package appv2.core.view

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
appv2.core.view.GameController
public class GameController extends Object

Controller for the Game Screen.
Handles the dynamic rendering of the Game Screen and the logic behind it.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field

    • getReturnCodeFromCallback

      private int getReturnCodeFromCallback(boolean bHandCard, StringBuilder stderrPipeline, StringBuilder stdoutPipeline, int finalI, String[] args)

      Gets the return code fo a callback of a played card.

      Parameters:
      bHandCard - Whether the card to play is a hand card or a table card.
      stderrPipeline - The stderr pipeline of the card.
      stdoutPipeline - The stdout pipeline of the card.
      finalI - The index of the player to choose.
      args - The arguments to pass to the callback.
      Returns:
      The return code of the card's callback.
      See Also:
      • ACard.callback(PlayerController, PlayerController, StringBuilder, StringBuilder, String[])

    • isStandardPlayerButtonBehaviourWhenChoosingValid

      private boolean isStandardPlayerButtonBehaviourWhenChoosingValid(javafx.scene.control.Button button, int finalI, int RC, StringBuilder stdoutPipeline, StringBuilder stderrPipeline)

      Standard behaviour of the return codes from a card's callback.

      Parameters:
      button - The button to disable if failed.
      finalI - The index of the player to choose.
      RC - The return code of the card's callback.
      stdoutPipeline - The stdout pipeline to get the information from.
      stderrPipeline - The stderr pipeline to get the information from.
      Returns:
      Whether the return code was handled or not.

    • isStandardPlayerButtonBehaviourWhenChoosingValidOnlyKnockedOut

      private boolean isStandardPlayerButtonBehaviourWhenChoosingValidOnlyKnockedOut(StringBuilder stdoutPipeline, int RC)

      Checks if the return code of a card's callback is RC_OK_PLAYER_KNOCKED_OUT and handles it if so.

      Parameters:
      stdoutPipeline - The stdout pipeline to get the information from.
      RC - The return code of the card's callback.
      Returns:
      Whether the return code was handled or not.

    • standardBehaviourIfNumberTextFieldIsInvalid

      private void standardBehaviourIfNumberTextFieldIsInvalid(javafx.scene.control.Label labelErr)

      Standard behaviour if the number text field is invalid (only used if the card's callback requires a number text field).

      Parameters:
      labelErr - The label to render.
      See Also:
      • playCard(boolean)

    • isbKnockedOutByPrincessHandCardAsHandCard

      private static boolean isbKnockedOutByPrincessHandCardAsHandCard()

      Needed for rare bug, where the player could play the Princess Annette Card as their hand card not their table card and the view would recognize the wrong card being played.

      Returns:
      Whether the player knocked himself out by playing a princess as hand card.

    • playCard

      private void playCard(boolean bHandCard)

      Handles the GUI-Logic if the player is playing a card.
      This also includes the rendering of the side effects of the cards.

      Parameters:
      bHandCard - Whether the card to play is a hand card or a table card.

    • showNoButtons

      private static boolean showNoButtons()

      Checks if the screen should show an buttons.

      Returns:
      True if we should not show any buttons, false otherwise. This is the case when the player is currently playing a card effect (e.g., guessing a card).

    • showEndTurnButton

      private static boolean showEndTurnButton(PlayerController PC)

      Checks if the screen should show the end turn button.

      Parameters:
      PC - The player controller to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is able to end the turn, false otherwise.

    • showHandCardButton

      private static boolean showHandCardButton(PlayerController PC)

      Checks if the screen should show the play hand card button.

      Parameters:
      PC - The player controller to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is able to play the hand card, false otherwise.

    • showTableCardButton

      private static boolean showTableCardButton(PlayerController PC)

      Checks if the screen should show the play table card button.

      Parameters:
      PC - The player controller to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is able to play the table card, false otherwise.

    • renderPlayerChoiceButtons

      private void renderPlayerChoiceButtons(javafx.scene.layout.VBox vbox)

      Renders the player choice buttons in the given VBox.
      This includes the buttons to play the hand card and the table card if available. Also includes the button to end the turn.

      Parameters:
      vbox - The VBox to render the player choice buttons in.
      See Also:
      • renderChoiceAreaScreen()

    • renderChoiceAreaScreen

      private void renderChoiceAreaScreen()

      Renders the choice area screen.
      Shows the cards that are playable by the current player and the buttons to play them. Also shows the cards that can be examined by the current player if available.

    • renderKnockedOutScreen

      private void renderKnockedOutScreen()

      Renders the screen for the player when they have been knocked out.

    • initialize

      private void initialize()

      Called by JavaFX when the Game Scene is initialized.
      Handles the rendering of the player interaction screen before the player's turn and prepares the player for their turn.

      See Also:
      • PlayerController.prepareForNextTurn()
